column4: Hey, I've been trying to install Skype on a Thinkpad x61 tablet, ubuntu 8.04. However when running the package installer it says: Error: Wrong architecture 'i386'. What could this be? This is an intel computer, and the package name is: skype-debian_2.2.0.0.72-1_i386.deb
no, I'm running the regular 32 bit
that doesn't make too much sense, the package may be malformed
keepsake and chubs: I downloaded it straight from www.skype.com they have a section called Ubuntu, that's where I got the package from. It's a bit strange.
does that mean I've got a 64 bit installation? I know for a fact my computer is 32 bit...
that's 64bit. you can force install the package as long as you have 32bit libraries installed and it'll work fine
your computer must be 64bit compatible ;) you wouldn't have been able to install it
PaMaNta: I'm trying to install skype on ubuntu 8.04
chubs: well, that's a positive surprise I guess! Haha. Do you know how I try and force the installation?
forgot the command, give me a minute
